text.headline: Private Wedding
text.text: President Mary Wooley and Jeanette Marks Wedding

text.headline: Ye Rose Tea Inn
text.text: Ye Rose Tea Inn, Bridge Street, Northampton.

text.headline: Male Dance Retreat at Jacob's Pillow
Search of mall for obscene materials
State law makes it a felony to possess for circulation/sale
Amherst HS Teacher fired
text.text: Amherst HIgh School Teacher fired for (among other things) being "effeminate"

text.headline: Poetry Reading
text.text: Roz Shapiro and Cindy S read Lesbian poetry in a (dorm) hallway at UMass

text.headline: Valley Women's Center opens
text.text: Amherst Women's Liberation opens the Valley Women's Center at 200 Main st., Northampton. VWM

text.headline: Dance in the Hatch with Steel
Gay-Straight Teach-In
text.text: SHL Lesbians present Gay-Straight Teach-in at Amherst Women's Liberation monthly meeting.

text.headline: Tri-County Fair
text.text: SHL and AWL share an information booth at the Tri-County Fair in Northampton

text.headline: New England Lesbian Feminist Conference
text.text: AWL and SHL send delegates to the regional conference in Kent, CT.

text.headline: Five College Women's Cultural Week
text.text: Deadly Nightshade emerges from retirement VWM

text.headline: The Full Moon newspaper
text.text: The first issue of the Full Moon newspaper is published by the Leverett Road Women's Collective. VWM

text.headline: Political Study Group
text.text: An attempt to start a Lesbian political study group

text.headline: Lesbian drop-in
text.text: Tuesday nights at the Valley Women's Center

text.headline: Project SELF
text.text: Everywoman's Center opens, Project SELF. First lesbian workshop, at UMass.

text.headline: Southwest Womens Center
text.text: Southwest Womens Center moves from closet to appartment and expands course offerings at UMass. VWM

text.headline: VWC Meeting
text.text: Meeting at the Valley Women's Center to discuss forming a Gay Coalition

text.headline: Women's Festival
text.text: Smith College hosts the Women's Festival with Deadly Nightshade VWM

text.headline: Womens Coffee House
text.text: Northampton Women's Coffee House is discussed VWM

text.headline: Lilith
text.text: The band Lilith plays at Smith College

text.headline: Lilith
text.text: The band Lilith plays at Mount Holyoke College
Second issue of The Full Moon is published

text.headline: The Women's Hour
text.text: Show is organized on WMUA, Tuesday from 8:00pm to 9:00 pm, by the Women and Media course. (SWWC) VWM

text.headline: Valley Women's Union
text.text: Valley Women's Center changes to a Union of: Mother Jones Press, Film Coop, Education, Employment, Staffing, Nesletter, Child Care, and Study and Research work groups. VWM

text.headline: Dance for Chomo-Uri
text.text: Benefit dance for Chomo-Uri with Lilith and Deadly Nightshade VWM?

text.headline: Lesbian Discussion group
text.text: Off-campus Lesbian discussion group (EWC/Southwest Resource Center)

text.headline: Friday night discussion groups
text.text: Lesbian garden space. Valley Women's Union

text.headline: University Women's Conference
text.text: 800 Women attend University Women's Conference sponsored by the Everywoman's Center, South West Womens Center and Women's Studies; this is presumably at UMass VWM

text.headline: "The Girl of Our Dreams"
text.text: "The Girl of Our Dreams" premiers and Amherst Repertory Company forms VWM

text.headline: Emma Goldman Brigade
text.text: Emma Goldman Brigade forms out of a Project SELF workshop on Anarchism and Feminism VWM

text.headline: Grand Jury Information Project begins
text.text: Northampton Women's Law Center/ SWU VWM

text.headline: Socialist Feminist Conference
text.text: >80 local women attend Socialist Feminist Conference VWM

text.headline: Lesbian Community Education and Self Defense/ Dyke Patrol form
Women's Health Care Collective forms
text.text: Women's Health Care Collective forms; branches out of the Community Health Care Collective VWM

text.headline: Lesbian Gardens
text.text: All Lesbian place is started. Coffee house group starts and brings Lesbian talent from all over the East to the LG every Saturday night until late spring.

text.headline: Sweetcoming Bookstore
text.text: Sweetcoming Bookstore, all women bookstore, opens. (LG).

text.headline: Women's Health Care Night on Tuesdays.
text.text: Women's Health Care night on Tuesdays. (Community Health Care Project). Florence. VWM

text.headline: UM Lesbian Union
text.text: UM Lesbian Union forms out of the Gay Women's Caucus of the People's Gay Alliance (old SHL).

text.headline: AFARCE vs. Lesbian-Separatists
text.text: Confrontation between AFARCE cast and some Lesbian-Separatists.

text.headline: Nutcracker's Suite
text.text: Nutcracker's Suite opens. Main Street, Northampton

text.headline: Mother Jones Press closes
text.text: Mother Jones Press closes and megaera Press opens as a Lesbian publishing company.

text.headline: Greasy Gorgon, Megaera, Film Coop form the Egg and Marigolths.
Ceres, Inc.
text.text: (Women's Restaurant Project) purchases property at 68-78 Masonic Street. Renovation begins

text.headline: They Will Know Me By My Teeth  is published. (Megaera Press).
UM Lesbian Union gets its own space
text.text: UM Lesbian Union gets its own space and starts Wednesday women's nights at Farley

text.headline: Talent Show to benefit Ceres, Inc.
Autumnal Celebration* with Liberty Standing benefit
MHC Lesbian support group sponsors eventss
Willie Tyson benefit for Megaera and Common Womon
VWU and LG evicted by the landlord
Sweetcoming BOokstoe moves to the Egg
Benefit dance for Chomo-Uri with Liberty Standing*
Robin Morgan benefit reading for Common Womon
VWU moves to space above Common Womon
Nutcrackers Suite
text.text: Women's Self Defence/ Karate Dojo moves to 68 Masonic Street . Navi is evicted

text.headline: "Waltz for Women's VOices" and "This Brooding Sky"* (AFARCE
MHC LIbrary suppresses love letters from former president
text.text: MHC Library suppresses love letters from former president Mary Wooley to Jaenette Marks an English professor

text.headline: Massage Day to benefit Women's Karate Camp
National Training Camp for Women and the Martial Arts
Karate/Self Defense demonstration for women of the community
Northampton community group on violence. (Gathering Society).
MHC Women's Center opens
text.text: MHC Women's Center opens with coalition of Lesbian support group, Women Present Women, and Women's Studies committee.

text.headline: Network of Feminist Therapists founding dinner at common Womon Club.
Birthday celebration
text.text: Common Womon is one year old. VWM

text.headline: Lilith benefit for Common Womon Club
Lesbian Affinity group
text.text: Lesbian Affinity group formed to occupy Seabrook disbanded when the occupation was called off.

text.headline: Women's Occupation of the Mass. Daily Collegian.
Publication of Both Feet in the Door
text.text: Publication of Both Feet in the Door by women who had taken over the Collegian Office

text.headline: Support Groups for Women
text.text: Support Groups for Women in Transition, Younger Women, Divorce, and Lesbians formed at the EWC.

text.headline: Jewish Lesbian Study Group forms
text.text: Jewish Lesbian Study Group forms and meets regularly through 1981.

text.headline: Valley Women's Voice started
text.text: Valley Women's Voice started with money from Women's Media Network; and later became an RSO group at UM.

text.headline: Support Groups for Women
text.text: Support Groups for Women Victims of Childhood Sexual Abuse, Rape Victims, Lesbian Rape Victims, Single Mothers, Lesbians, Black Women, Divorced Women, and General Support Group begin at EWC.

text.headline: First Lesbian Arts and Crafts Show
text.text: A benefit for the National Lesbbian Workforce Exchange Project at 19 Hawley St, Northampton.

text.headline: Northampton
text.text: Mary Daly speaks on Gyno-Ecology at a reception for the author at Womonfyre books.

text.headline: First Issue of Valley Womens's Voice
First Wendell Country Women's Music Festival
Publication of Jan Raymond's book, The Transexual Empire
Women's Media Project expands
text.text: Women's Media Project expands to Women's Media Network, attempts to beome a resource center for women in the media in the Valley.

text.headline: New Alexandria Lesbian Library
text.text: New Alexandria Lesbian Library (founded 1974) moves Chicago to Crescent Moon Farm outside of Huntington, MA.

text.headline: Lesbian Forum formed
text.text: Lesbian Forum formed to deal with lesbian issues, has turned into discussion group.

text.headline: The Wanderground reading by Sally Gearhart
text.text: The Wanderground reading by the author Sally Gearhart and reception at Womonfyre Books.

text.headline: JEB visits Northampton
text.text: JEB visits Northampton, presents a slide show of lessbian photographs from mid-19th century to the present, reception at Womonfyre Books.

text.headline: JEB - Lesbian Images in slide show
text.text: JEB- Lesbian Images in Photography Slide Show at Unitarian Church, Northampton  (also at MHC).

text.headline: 24 hours of women's programming on WMUA
"A Poetry Reading for Lesbians"
text.text: Bet Birdfish, director of NALL, and Vemita Gray, Black Lesbian from Chicago, read their poetry at Chrysalis theatre and talk about NALL. Sponsored by Old Lady Blue Jeans

text.headline: Owners of Womonfyre Books, are threatened with vandalism and rape
text.text: Jil Krolik and Kiryo Spooner, owners of Womonfyre Books, are threatened with vandalism and rape by a group of 4 white men who invaded the bookstore.

text.headline: Valley Women's Voice moved to Northampton
SCLA  discussions
text.text: SCLA met Sunday nights for discussion on different topics

text.headline: New Alexandria Lesbian Library moves to Worthington
text.text: New Alexandria Lesbian Library moves from Crescent Moon Star Farm in Huntington, MA to Worthington, MA.

text.headline: Margie Adam performs at the Iron Horse
Performance at Polish Club
text.text: Linda Tillery and Mary Watkins perform at the Polish Club.

text.headline: New Alexandria Lesbian Library moves to Leeds. MA
Toni Cade Bambara speaks at Smith College
text.text: Toni Cade Bambara speaks at Smith College, reading from her short story collection, Gorilla My Love, sponsored by Afro-American Studies at Smith, Black Studies at Amherst College, and Womonfyre Books.

text.headline: Women coming out as lesbians support group
La Mix formed
text.text: La Mix formed, prior to this they had worked together without a name At Rahars for six weeks. La Mix started having women's dances at Hangar One.

text.headline: Third World Lesbian Gathering at HC
First meeting of GALA
text.text: First meeting of GALA (Gay and Lesbian Activists), potluck with 15 people.

text.headline: Dance at Davis
text.text: Dance at Davic, music by Faye. sponsored by SCLA, Women in Struggle, and Northampton Committee on El Salvador.
